section.title: Tutorial 5: Exporting Data
section.para: Data can be exported from the result pages in various formats - excel (or open office) format, comma separated values, tab separated values, or for items with sequences, FASTA format (see below).

This tutorial will illustrate how to export data from a results table and from a bag. As an example, run the template 'gene --> GO terms' (Gene Ontology aspect) for the default value 'CG11348'. Currently, either the entire results table or specific columns can be exported. If nothing is selected, the entire data set will be exported. If you do not wish to export certain columns, then hide these columns using the 'hide' option in the column header.

If the results table contains a column with objects that have a nucleotide or amino acid sequence, it is possible to export all sequences from that column in FASTA format. Currently, the FASTA export option will export the sequences belonging to objects in the first visible (i.e. not hidden) column only. Therefore, if that column does not contain any sequence-linked objects, the FASTA export option will not be activated. Columns can be moved to the first position by using the arrows in the header. If objects appear more than once in the column, the sequence will only be exported once.

Values stored in bags can also be exported. To export the contents of a bag, click on the bag name on the 'Bags' page. This will display the contents of the bag as a results page - with the export options available at the bottom of the page. Currently, it is not possible to export single items from the bag. Therefore, it is not necessary to tick any check-boxes in the bag as the whole bag will always be exported.
